device_mount: Handheld; Placed loosely around user (e.g., table)
use_cases_desc: Game and map application showing the 3D virtual space
contribution_desc:
This paper demonstrates the use of a conductive smartphone case with protuberances to determine the relative spatial positions and angles when a smartphone is positioned on top of a horizontal tablet. The smartphone, when held perpendicular to the tablet, can then served as a 3D virtual porthole into the 2D map displayed on the tablet. This paper lacks some depth, but it shows an extremely cool (in my opinion) application of cross-device interaction for extending the screen space.

Contribution: "System" -> "3D visualization"
contribution: Tracking technology; Use-case, application; Toolkit, middleware
